com.ti.debug.engine.scripting

Class Simultaneous

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ti.debug.engine.scripting.Simultaneous

  • public class Simultaneous
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates the simultaneous run-control methods (run, halt, etc.), used to perform run-control actions on multiple targets simultaneously.

    Simultaneous functions will be using the timeout value from the environment, and logging will go to the environment log file.

    // Create Environment and open a debug session
    ScriptingEnvironment env = ScriptingEnvironment.instance();
    DebugServer myServer = (DebugServer) env.getServer("DebugServer.1");
    DebugSession mySession1 = myServer.openSession("*", "CPU1");
    DebugSession mySession2 = myServer.openSession("*", "CPU2");
    DebugSession mySession3 = myServer.openSession("*", "CPU3");

    ...

    // Run, halt, and run
    myServer.simultaneous.runAsynch(); // Run all CPUs asynchronously
    myServer.simultaneous.halt(); // Halt all CPUs
    myServer.simultaneous.run(new DebugSession[]{mySession1, mySession2}); // Run CPUs 1 and 2

      void asmStepInto()
      Simultaneously step into a line of assembly code on all targets belonging to open unterminated sessions.

    • Method Detail

      • asmStepInto

        public void asmStepInto()
                 throws ScriptingException
        Simultaneously step into a line of assembly code on all targets belonging to open unterminated sessions.

        On timeout, a ScriptingException is thrown detailing which sessions timed out. Subsequent behaviour of these sessions is undefined.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • asmStepInto

        public void asmStepInto(DebugSession[] sessions)
                 throws ScriptingException
        Simultaneously step into a line of assembly code on the targets belonging to the specified sessions.

        On timeout, a ScriptingException is thrown detailing which sessions timed out. Subsequent behaviour of these sessions is undefined.
        Parameters:
        sessions - an array of DebugSessions, whose targets are to be stepped into
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • halt

        public void halt()
          throws ScriptingException
        Simultaneously halt all targets belonging to open unterminated sessions. Used to halt a simultaneous asynchronous run initiated using runAsynch().

        On timeout, a ScriptingException is thrown detailing which sessions timed out. Subsequent behaviour of these sessions is undefined.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • halt

        public void halt(DebugSession[] sessions)
          throws ScriptingException
        Simultaneously halt the targets belonging the specified sessions. Used to halt a simultaneous asynchronous run initiated using runAsynch(DebugSession[]).

        On timeout, a ScriptingException is thrown detailing which sessions timed out. Subsequent behaviour of these sessions is undefined.
        Parameters:
        sessions - an array of DebugSessions, whose targets are to be halted
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • run

        public void run()
         throws ScriptingException
        Simultaneously run all targets belonging to open unterminated sessions. Do not return control to the host application/script until all targets have been halted due to hitting a breakpoint, hitting the end of a program, or timing out.

        On timeout, a ScriptingException is thrown detailing which sessions timed out. Subsequent behaviour of these sessions is undefined.

        If the scripting environment timeout is set to infinite and the target application has a continuous loop this method may never return.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • run

        public void run(DebugSession[] sessions)
         throws ScriptingException
        Simultaneously run the targets belonging to the specified sessions. Do not return control to the host application/script until all targets have been halted due to hitting a breakpoint, hitting the end of a program, or timing out.

        On timeout, a ScriptingException is thrown detailing which sessions timed out. Subsequent behaviour of these sessions is undefined.

        If the scripting environment timeout is set to infinite and the target application has a continuous loop this method may never return.
        Parameters:
        sessions - an array of DebugSessions, whose targets are to be run
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • runAsynch

        public void runAsynch()
               throws ScriptingException
        Simultaneously run all targets belonging to open unterminated sessions. Return control immediately (even if targets are still running) to the host application/script. Use halt() to stop the targets.

        On timeout, a ScriptingException is thrown detailing which sessions timed out. Subsequent behaviour of these sessions is undefined.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • runAsynch

        public void runAsynch(DebugSession[] sessions)
               throws ScriptingException
        Simultaneously run the targets belonging to the specified sessions. Return control immediately (even if targets are still running) to the host application/script. Use halt(DebugSession[]) to stop the targets.

        On timeout, a ScriptingException is thrown detailing which sessions timed out. Subsequent behaviour of these sessions is undefined.
        Parameters:
        sessions - an array of DebugSessions, whose targets are to be run
        Throws:
        ScriptingException
